thread.section_title: The Union Democrat, Sonora, CA News, Sports, & Weather
thread.title: Police arrest suspected car thief

title: Police arrest suspected car thief
text: Police arrest suspected car thief Police arrest suspected car thief By Alex MacLean, The Union Democrat October 01, 2015 01:00 am Sonora police arrested a Columbia man on suspicion of vehicle theft Wednesday at the corner of South Washington and Linoberg streets. About 12:14 p.m., two officers on foot spotted a silver Toyota RAV4 that had been reported stolen by the owner on the morning of Sept. 26 from the 100 block of Hillcrest Drive in Sonora, according to Sonora Police Chief Mark Stinson. According to Stinson, officers stopped the vehicle at South Washington and Linoberg streets and arrested the driver, Brian Knight, 38, on suspicion of felony vehicle theft, an outstanding felony theft warrant and two misdemeanor warrants, Stinson said. Another man in the vehicle, whose name was not released as of press time, was allegedly found with a small amount of methamphetamine and arrested on suspicion of misdemeanor drug possession, Stinson said. Both men were booked into Tuolumne County Jail. Stinson said the RAV4 was returned to the owner with minimal damage. Follow UnionDemocrat.com
